summary.long: Jonah is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: Now the word of the Lord came to Jonah son of Amittai, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Go at once to Nineveh, that great city, and cry out against it, for their wickedness has come up before me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jonah set out to flee to Tarshish from the presence of the Lord. He went down to Joppa and found a ship going to Tarshish; so he paid his fare and went on board, to go with them to Tarshish, away from the presence of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord hurled a great wind upon the sea, and such a mighty storm came upon the sea that the ship threatened to break up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the sailors were afraid, and each cried to his god. They threw the cargo that was in the ship into the sea, to lighten it for them. Jonah, meanwhile, had gone down into the hold of the ship and had lain down and was fast asleep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The captain came and said to him, “What are you doing sound asleep? Get up; call on your god! Perhaps the god will spare us a thought so that we do not perish.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sailors said to one another, “Come, let us cast lots, so that we may know on whose account this calamity has come upon us.” So they cast lots, and the lot fell on Jonah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they said to him, “Tell us why this calamity has come upon us. What is your occupation? Where do you come from? What is your country? And of what people are you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I am a Hebrew,” he replied. “I worship the Lord, the God of heaven, who made the sea and the dry land.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the men were even more afraid and said to him, “What is this that you have done!” For the men knew that he was fleeing from the presence of the Lord, because he had told them so.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they said to him, “What shall we do to you, that the sea may quiet down for us?” For the sea was growing more and more tempestuous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Pick me up and throw me into the sea; then the sea will quiet down for you, for I know it is because of me that this great storm has come upon you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless, the men rowed hard to bring the ship back to land, but they could not, for the sea grew more and more stormy against them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they cried out to the Lord, “Please, O Lord, we pray, do not let us perish on account of this man’s life. Do not make us guilty of innocent blood, for you, O Lord, have done as it pleased you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they picked Jonah up and threw him into the sea, and the sea ceased from its raging.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the men feared the Lord even more, and they offered a sacrifice to the Lord and made vows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord provided a large fish to swallow up Jonah, and Jonah was in the belly of the fish three days and three nights.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jonah prayed to the Lord his God from the belly of the fish,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
saying,
“I called to the Lord out of my distress,
    and he answered me;
out of the belly of Sheol I cried,
    and you heard my voice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You cast me into the deep,
    into the heart of the seas,
    and the flood surrounded me;
all your waves and your billows
    passed over me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then I said, ‘I am driven away
    from your sight;
how shall I look again
    upon your holy temple?’
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
at the roots of the mountains.
I went down to the land
    whose bars closed upon me forever;
yet you brought up my life from the Pit,
    O Lord my God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As my life was ebbing away,
    I remembered the Lord,
and my prayer came to you,
    into your holy temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who worship vain idols
    forsake their true loyalty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But I with the voice of thanksgiving
    will sacrifice to you;
what I have vowed I will pay.
    Deliverance belongs to the Lord!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord spoke to the fish, and it vomited Jonah out onto the dry land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word of the Lord came to Jonah a second time, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Get up, go to Nineveh, that great city, and proclaim to it the message that I tell you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jonah set out and went to Nineveh, according to the word of the Lord. Now Nineveh was an exceedingly large city, a three days’ walk across.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jonah began to go into the city, going a day’s walk. And he cried out, “Forty days more, and Nineveh shall be overthrown!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people of Nineveh believed God; they proclaimed a fast, and everyone, great and small, put on sackcloth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the news reached the king of Nineveh, he rose from his throne, removed his robe, covered himself with sackcloth, and sat in ashes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he had a proclamation made in Nineveh: “By the decree of the king and his nobles: No human or animal, no herd or flock, shall taste anything. They shall not feed, nor shall they drink water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Humans and animals shall be covered with sackcloth, and they shall cry mightily to God. All shall turn from their evil ways and from the violence that is in their hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who knows? God may relent and change his mind; he may turn from his fierce anger, so that we do not perish.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When God saw what they did, how they turned from their evil ways, God changed his mind about the calamity that he had said he would bring upon them, and he did not do it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But this was very displeasing to Jonah, and he became angry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He prayed to the Lord and said, “O Lord! Is not this what I said while I was still in my own country? That is why I fled to Tarshish at the beginning, for I knew that you are a gracious and merciful God, slow to anger, abounding in steadfast love, and relenting from punishment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now, O Lord, please take my life from me, for it is better for me to die than to live.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said, “Is it right for you to be angry?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jonah went out of the city and sat down east of the city and made a booth for himself there. He sat under it in the shade, waiting to see what would become of the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord God appointed a bush and made it come up over Jonah, to give shade over his head, to save him from his discomfort, so Jonah was very happy about the bush.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when dawn came up the next day, God appointed a worm that attacked the bush, so that it withered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the sun rose, God prepared a sultry east wind, and the sun beat down on the head of Jonah so that he was faint and asked that he might die. He said, “It is better for me to die than to live.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But God said to Jonah, “Is it right for you to be angry about the bush?” And he said, “Yes, angry enough to die.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said, “You are concerned about the bush, for which you did not labor and which you did not grow; it came into being in a night and perished in a night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And should I not be concerned about Nineveh, that great city, in which there are more than a hundred and twenty thousand persons who do not know their right hand from their left and also many animals?”
verses.speaker: Narrator
